intro: Alcea afghanica, commonly known as Afghan hollyhock, is a flowering plant native to Afghanistan and surrounding regions. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, rose-like flowers in shades of pink, red, and white, typically blooming in summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, giving them a soft texture. Alcea afghanica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained soils.
